DataElement.preferredName: Positive Finding EGFR Phosphorylation Process Pixel Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response regarding the ratio of positively phosphorylated EGFR as compared to the total number of pixels in a given area as a percentage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positive Finding Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Phosphorylation Process Pixel Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._The protein found on the surface of some cells and to which epidermal growth factor binds, causing the cells to divide. It is found at abnormally high levels on the surface of many types of cancer cells, so these cells may divide excessively in the presence of epidermal growth factor._The creation of a phosphate derivative of an organic molecule. This is usually achieved by transferring a phosphate group from ATP via the action of a kinase._The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Positive Finding Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Phosphorylation Process Pixel
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:The protein found on the surface of some cells and to which epidermal growth factor binds, causing the cells to divide. It is found at abnormally high levels on the surface of many types of cancer cells, so these cells may divide excessively in the presence of epidermal growth factor.:The creation of a phosphate derivative of an organic molecule. This is usually achieved by transferring a phosphate group from ATP via the action of a kinase.:The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
Epidermal growth factor receptor (1210 aa, ~134 kDa) is encoded by the human EGFR gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion, cell migration, cell proliferation and signal transduction.
The creation of a phosphate derivative of an organic molecule. This is usually achieved by transferring a phosphate group from ATP via the action of a kinase.
The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.

Property.preferredDefinition: Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
